title: How to Make a Chocolate Cake

steps.title: Sift the dry ingredients together.
steps.content: Sift the dry ingredients together. The dry ingredients are the flour, cocoa powder, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Place all the dry ingredients in a sifter and shake it back and forth over a bowl to eliminate the clumps.

steps.title: Stir in the liquid ingredients and mix well.
steps.content: Stir in the liquid ingredients and mix well. These are the eggs, vegetable oil, sour cream, and vanilla extract. Some people like to add these ingredients individually, but others stir them together in a second bowl and before adding them to the dry ingredients.

steps.title: Grease and flour an 8 inch round pan.
steps.content: Grease and flour an 8 inch round pan. Slowly pour the cake batter in. Make sure to get every bit of the batter into the pan.

steps.title: Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for 30 minutes
steps.content: Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for 30 minutes .

steps.title: Let the cake cool for five minutes.
steps.content: Let the cake cool for five minutes.

steps.title: Wait until the cake is completely cool.
steps.content: Wait until the cake is completely cool. Then you may frost or decorate as desired. Enjoy!

steps.title: Prepare to make the cake.
steps.content: Prepare to make the cake. Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit or 162° Celsius. Grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans.

steps.title: Mix the dry ingredients.
steps.content: Mix the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cocoa powder, and sugar. Mix until the dry ingredients are properly folded in.

steps.title: Add the coffee, oil, and buttermilk.
steps.content: Add the coffee, oil, and buttermilk. Pour in the hot coffee, canola oil, and buttermilk into the dry ingredients. Mix using a whisk or hand blender, until the ingredients resemble a light brown cake batter.

steps.title: Add the eggs and vanilla.
steps.content: Add the eggs and vanilla. Crack in the eggs and pour in the vanilla extract into the cake batter. Mix one last time until there are no more flour streaks and the chocolate cake batter is slightly thick.

steps.title: Pour batter into the cake pans.
steps.content: Pour batter into the cake pans. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.

steps.title: Bake the cake.
steps.content: Bake the cake. Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about an hour, until the cake rises and is fluffy. Check to see if the cake is ready by sticking a small knife in the middle. If it comes out clean, it is fully baked.

steps.title: Let the cake cool.
steps.content: Let the cake cool. Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave them until they are cool enough to touch.

steps.title: Frost and decorate.
steps.content: Frost and decorate. Consider stacking both cakes to make a two-layer chocolate cake. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles

steps.title: Serve and enjoy!
steps.content: Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!

steps.title: Sift the dry ingredients except the sugar.
steps.content: Sift the dry ingredients except the sugar. In a large bowl, sift the flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, and baking soda with a whisk. Mix until properly combined.

steps.title: Add the sugar.
steps.content: Add the sugar. Carefully pour in the sugar into the dry ingredients. Mix again with the whisk until the sugar combines in with the dry ingredients.

steps.title: Fold in the wet ingredients.
steps.content: Fold in the wet ingredients. Pour in the vegetable oil, water, and vanilla extract into the dry ingredients. Stir with a whisk or a hand blender until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.

steps.title: Pour the batter into the pan.
steps.content: Pour the batter into the pan. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.

steps.title: Bake the cake.
steps.content: Bake the cake. Place the cake pan in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about an hour, until the cake rises and is fluffy.

steps.title: Let the cake cool.
steps.content: Let the cake cool. Remove the pan from the oven and have the cake cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes. Leave the cake until it is cool enough to touch.

steps.title: Frost and decorate.
steps.content: Frost and decorate. Frost with chocolate chocolate buttercream frosting and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles.

steps.title: Serve and enjoy!
steps.content: Serve and enjoy! Slice the chocolate cake and serve on a serving plate. Enjoy!

steps.title: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.content: Combine the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Mix the ingredients with a whisk and then form a well in the middle of the bowl.

steps.title: Add the wet ingredients.
steps.content: Add the wet ingredients. Pour in the soy or almond milk, vinegar, eggs, brewed coffee, and dairy-free sour cream into the well. Use a blender to mix for about two minutes until the cake batter forms and there are no more flour streaks.

steps.title: Pour batter into cake pans.
steps.content: Pour batter into cake pans. Using a rubber spatula, scrape the cake batter into both of the cake pans. Remove any leftover batter by scraping the edges of the bowl.

steps.title: Bake the cake.
steps.content: Bake the cake. Place both cake pans in the oven to bake. Have the cake bake for about 30-40 minutes, until the cake rises and is fluffy.

steps.title: Let the cake cool.
steps.content: Let the cake cool. Remove both pans from the oven and have the cakes cool for about twenty minutes on a wire rack. Leave both cakes until they are cool enough to touch.

steps.title: Frost and decorate.
steps.content: Frost and decorate. Consider stacking both cakes to make a two-layer chocolate cake. Frost with chocolate buttercream frosting and/or decorate with any desired toppings such as berries, powdered sugar, coconut flakes, and sprinkles

steps.title: Serve and enjoy!
